data.name: The Type of page field is required.
data.value: The Type of page field is required.

data.name:
The type of your page used to mark them differently in the sitemap
Default: select this option if you do not know your page type
Static: contains only manually inputted static content
Dynamic: contains dynamic content from database either via the datarule or your own API query.
data.value:
The type of your page used to mark them differently in the sitemap
Default: select this option if you do not know your page type
Static: contains only manually inputted static content
Dynamic: contains dynamic content from database either via the datarule or your own API query.

data.name: The Search index field is required.
data.value: The Search index field is required.

data.name: Include this page content in the search index.
data.value: Include this page content in the search index.

data.name: The Require HTTPS field is required.
data.value: The Require HTTPS field is required.

data.name: Force this page to use HTTPS, similar as the RequireHttpsAttribute in ASP.NET MVC.
data.value: Force this page to use HTTPS, similar as the RequireHttpsAttribute in ASP.NET MVC.

data.name: Make this page accessible from the Crumb path API.
data.value: Make this page accessible from the Crumb path API.

data.name: Make this page accessible from the menu API.
data.value: Make this page accessible from the menu API.

data.name: The order of page in the menu API. Drag and drop to change them.
data.value: The order of page in the menu API. Drag and drop to change them.

data.name:
The title tag and value that appear in the page HTML header and also used by browsers as the page title.

data.value:
The title tag and value that appear in the page HTML header and also used by browsers as the page title.

data.value: Custom fields for HTML meta values

data.value: In this field you can insert an external URL in case a menu items need to link externally. e.g:http://forum.kooboo.com/.

data.name: Give your page an alternative name. This new name will be used when generating page links. Start with '/' to indicate using as absolute path.
data.value: Give your page an alternative name. This new name will be used when generating page links. Start with '/' to indicate using as absolute path.

data.name: The route URL cannot start with a '/' or '~' character and it cannot contain a '?' character.
data.value: The route URL cannot start with a '/' or '~' character and it cannot contain a '?' character.

data.name:
Customize the page URL to anyway you like.
Use {key} to match the URL query string.
For example: {userkey}_othertext to replace parameter "?userkey=" into static URL.
Use {*ModuleURL} to match all the query string after ModuleURL.
data.value:
Customize the page URL to anyway you like.
Use {key} to match the URL query string.
For example: {userkey}_othertext to replace parameter "?userkey=" into static URL.
Use {*ModuleURL} to match all the query string after ModuleURL.
